article_title: Ship lines accuse union of slowing up cargo, again
article_text: Ship lines and terminals on the West Coast are accusing the  dockworkers union there of a continuing effort to hamper cargo  movements.  The Pacific Maritime Association, which represents employers on  the coast, issued a statement late Thursday saying the union was  refusing to dispatch skilled workers to key Southern California  yards where marine containers are loaded onto trains and trucks  headed inland.
